NeoModernist

That is correct since born people are protected citizens and you have other options once the child is born.
 
 Is the blah blah blah part supposed to be you being dismissive? Grow up. I wouldn't insult your intelligence if it should ever appear.

 
 You have constantly missed it. I guess I should not be surprised. Perhaps you need things spell out for you, as I would to a grade schooler. So here it is.
 
 Simone predicated an argument for abortion based on the fitness of the mother. And she alone is the arbitrator of that decision.
 
"Am I prepared to be a mother?", who gets to answer it?
 
 Is it the role of the State or of the Church to tell her what the answer to that question is?

 By doing so she also attempted to bypass the status of the child.
 
 The flaw of the argument was condensed into my counter statement, that you unwittingly only demonstrated.
 That fitness is not reason enough, because it all depends on when society determines the child is to be protected. That a 2 years old child is societally protected means that her fitness as a mother of a 2 years old child is irrelevant in whether she can kill the child is or not. She does not have that right. And thus similarly her fitness as a mother is irrelevant if a fetus is societally protected. Her ability to act on another as predicated by fitness or unfitness as a mother is irrelevant as soon as another life is threatened by her. Society decides who among its member are to be protected from others.
 A simple transposition of the child's age exemplified this.
 
 emoticon_rolleyes
sinjin

Society decides who among its member are to be protected from others.
 

 
 A fetus is not a member of society yet. Not even a "who" yet.
 
 A. Crack-addicted unfit mother of 2 yr. old - Society does?
 
 B. Crack-addicted pregnant soon to be unfit mother - Society does?
NeoModernist

A fetus is not a member of society yet. Not even a "who" yet.
 
 A. Crack-addicted unfit mother of 2 yr. old - Society does?
 
 B. Crack-addicted pregnant soon to be unfit mother - Society does?

 
 Don't be dense.
 
 When society chooses to define a fetus as a member of society, it will be a member of society and legally protect via a ban on abortion. This can simply be done by over turning RvW. 
 btw, You do realize that Roe vs Wade decision was not predicated on when a fetus is to be protected, right?
 Regardless on where you stand on abortion, it was a societal decision to permit it, as well as a society decision to limit it.
 
 And yes, society can decide a mother is unfit and remove her children. But if she deems herself unfit and abandons her children she has commited a crime.

sinjin

Naturally. I only respond in kind.

 Then let us proceed in civility.
 
 The minority that would protect the fetus base their position primarily on religious grounds which cannot be scientifically confirmed. For my part I just do not consider the termination of non-sentient life comparable to killing sentient life from a cruelty standpoint. That puts me in the first trimester OK group.
 
 SCOTUS must consider precedence and while they might reverse themselves on this issue, they would need grounds to do so beyond what is offered by the pro-life forces IMO.
NeoModernist

I am not particularly interested in an argument of the merit of abortions. I do not believe it is a topic that minds can be changed. When a biological human becomes a person worthy of legal protection has become a matter of faith. To inject principles of science to value judgements of faith would be erroneous. Thus there is little room for meaningful debate.
 
 I only criticized the absurd attempt to predicate the right of abortion based on a woman self assesment of fitness as the catalyst to abort and have this be isolated from societal mores and participation.
